On the same day that N icolas Patron went out against the Guaranies with troops of Cor- rientine horse, O'aherkaikin and his companions, now freed from fear, bade adieu to the colony of St. Ferdinand, intending to live, as formerly, on rapine in the country. His example was followed by the inhabitants of other colonies.
